narratives.question_text: How clearly did the instructor define the topic of study?
comments: Helped with handouts and applied examples, the class is fun and enjoyable.

narratives.question_text: How clearly did the instructor outline the expectation for the course, classroom activity and homework?
comments: Alan is awesome. Fun, always available to answer questions and curiosity.

narratives.question_text: How well were individual class sessions prepared and presented?
comments: There were a some topics that had to be shifted around and modified based on Spencer's (the TA) availability to teach them. It was disorganized at times.

sometimes i found it difficult to keep a track of the continuation of topics as the gap between the classes was one too many days. also practical sessions need to be longer. two classes a week with one being 1hr/1.5hr and the other 2hr/3hr. can help.
Always integrated by practical examples and handouts

narratives.question_text: How well did lectures fit within the boundaries of the course?
comments: excellent
He never exhagerate on working load. Could be a little more though. I would not mind.

I think you can go completely nuts with the workload, or super-light. I would've liked a bit more practice with calculating flow rates and some other math bits just to cement all of that since we don't tend to use it terribly often. Those sorts of assignments don't take long but are helpful.

narratives.question_text: How available was the instructor for help outside the classroom?
comments: The TAs availability was more important to me and most of my classmates, as nearly all our work on assignments in this class happened after 6pm.
Alan lives in B1, so easy to stop by to any question he is always available to help with

narratives.question_text: How useful were assignments in furthering an understanding of the topic?
comments: There could be some additional voluntary assignments to pursue more advanced understanding of this program.
some more very basic review exercises may help. as simple as identify the parts. we did one. but a couple of more involving pneumatics, especially one for pneumatics.
Two main assignments in this class, lots of fun playing with chaos

narratives.question_text: If tests were given, how fairly did they measure knowledge gained?
comments: super fair

narratives.question_text: How useful was this course in preparing you for production work?
comments: It's a big leap to try drafting in a new program in the process of a show. I didn't feel it would be a responsible move, but I look forward to integrating onto a project soon.
really useful, hands on part really important.
Whatever I've forgotten, I've got notes on! Alan is the best at providing tons of resources, which, combined with good class notes and his textbook, leave a student well-armed for production work.

narratives.question_text: How would you evaluate the instructor's knowledge of the material?
comments: There numerous students who are more knowledgeable about the program, but this is nice because there are a number of people to ask questions.
Ha, nobody knows more than Alan about stage machinery, yet!

narratives.question_text: Please offer additional comments on such topics as: what worked best about the course, suggested improvements, class materials, etc.
comments: have an exercise about ordering parts ? i.e. budgeting a system then preparing an online order, talking to vendors, etc.
I loved to learn with Alan.
